Date:  Thu, 26 Feb 2015 13:40:59 +0100
From:  Erik Bryssinck 
Subject:  image comet C/2014 Q2 (LOVEJOY) 25 febr.
Hello,

here my last 2 observations of comet Lovejoy and immediately achieved the
milestone of 100 observations (of this particular comet) that I have
achieved in collaboration with Franz-Josef Hambsch from his remote
observatory (ROAD-Chile) and my own back-yard observatory.

23 febr.2015:

http://www.astronomie.be/erik.bryssinck/c2014q2_20150223.html

25 febr.2015

http://www.astronomie.be/erik.bryssinck/c2014q2_20150225.html

___________________________________

kind regards,

Erik Bryssinck & Franz-Josef Hambsch

ROAD, Chile (MPC:G39)

BRIXIIS Observatory, Belgium (MPC:B96)

http://www.astronomie.be/erik.bryssinck/

___________________________________

CARA - Cometary Archive for Af(rho) : http://cara.uai.it

VVS - Belgian association for amateur astronomers : http://www.vvs.be

Subject:  C 2015 C2, C 2015 D2 and C 2015 D3 News Comets
Good morning.

T400RC Remote, SpaceObs., A. Maury, Chile :

C 2015 C2 SWAN, 20150226, 27 and 28
without filter, sampling of 1.03"/pixel, coma : +/-1'30
tail : +/- 7' long, PA : 135°, m2 : 13.3 (+/-0.2),
aperture radius for measures : 10.3"
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/imageC2015C2SwanChile.htm

C 2015 D2 Panstarrs, 20150220
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/imageC2015D2PanstarrsChile.htm

Date:  Sun, 01 Mar 2015 01:28:08 +0100
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  Image 88P/Howell on February 26
Object/Date:88P/Howell @ 2015-02-26
Tech data:Planewave 20" CDK f/4.4 reflector + FLI PL09000 camera (L:1×120 Bin1)
Description:Comet 88P/Howell imaged on February 26, 2015. With a brightness near 10.5 magnitude shows a coma of 3' diameter quite condensed and a inkling of wide and short tail toward west.
Location:Remotely from Siding Spring (Australia)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/88p-howell-26feb2015/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo

Taken from Sancheong, South Korea using Sigma Art 50mm (F1.4) lens and EOS 5D Mark III camera on SkyExplorer II mount.

2015-02-13.
6 x 2 min exposures.

Date:  Mon, 02 Mar 2015 08:32:43 -0800
From:  jbrimaco@bigpond.net.au
Subject:  Comet C/2014 Q2 Lovejoy Widefield L - March 1, 2015
Taken from New Mexico Skies using an FSQ 10.6-cm and STL11K camera on a PME II mount with AOL guiding. Time: 02h 07m UT; 1 x 20 min exposure; bright moonlight

LINK
Positive image: https://www.flickr.com/photos/43846774@N02/16509273429/
Negative image: https://www.flickr.com/photos/43846774@N02/16669483816/
False color image: https://www.flickr.com/photos/43846774@N02/16507860038/

Clear, still skies
Joe

Joseph Brimacombe

Date:  Sat, 07 Mar 2015 07:35:44 +0100
From:  ligustri rolando 
Subject:  comet C/2014 Q2 at 07/03/2015
http://www.astrobin.com/full/161944/0/

apo 106/530 ccd PL11002 L=600sec field 155'x205'

The presence of the moon has reduced the contrast, but this beautiful space vagabond
continues to be a beautiful object. In the upper right corner you see the star delta
Cass,

best regards
Rolando Ligustri

10"/4.0 4x270sec filter UV/IR

Michael Jäger

From:  michaeljaeger@gmx.at
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] C/2015 D1 march 7
Dear Alfons

You need deep images and dark sky for this faint ghost
On Feb 28 it was easy to see after 5-10sec. Now i had problems to find it after 20sec at 4x4 mod.

Regards
Michael

From:  Rob Kaufman 
Subject:  C/2015 C2 (SWAN), 08 March 2015
Managed to image this comet tonight under difficult conditions of very low
altitude, light twilight sky and smoke in air. Happy to get any trace at
all, definitely the last chance from here.

From:  ligustri rolando

HI Chris, it's a normal monocromatic ccd with RGB filter

L=600s in bin1 RGB=60s in bin2

regards
Rolando

Subject:  The Twin Jets of Comet C/2014 Q2 Lovejoy Narrowfield C - Feb 26, 2015
Taken from New Mexico Skies Observatory using an 51-cm RCOS telescope and STXL-6303 camera on a PME II mount.
Time: 03h 27m UT; 60 x 1 min exposures; binned 2x2

LINKS
Positive image: https://www.flickr.com/photos/43846774@N02/16586386098/

Date:  Tue, 10 Mar 2015 16:33:43 +0100
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) on January 23
A delayed image...
Comet C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) imaged on January 23, 2015 from my backyard, at that time showed a long tail of more than 9 deg longitude. At top right is the reflection nebula NGC 1333.

Location:Vallés, Valencia (Spain) Tech data:Canon lens @ 96mm. f/5,6 + Canon EOS-100D camera (6x300 sec. @ ISO 400)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/2014q2-lovejoy-23ene2015/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo 

Date:  Tue, 10 Mar 2015 16:48:34 -0700

Michael Jäger 
Date:  Wed, 11 Mar 2015 01:21:14 +0100
From:  Adriano 
Subject:  C/2014 Q2 near Dolphin Nebula Sh2-188
This is the color version of the C/2014 Q2, taken March 8, 2015, near the Dolphin nebula Sh2-188.
http://www.astrobin.com/162986/
Regards

Adriano Valvasorihttp://astronomiaperpassione.blogspot.it/ 
Date:  Wed, 11 Mar 2015 01:17:06 -0400
From:  "Paul A. Valleli" 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] 2014 Q2 Lovejoy HalphaLRGB March 10
Now that is a spectactular comet image, Michael.
One that you can be proud of for a lifetime.
What a shame that so few of the public have been aware of this sky show !
Newspapers, TV, and the Internet failed to inform.
Starman paul

Date:  Wed, 11 Mar 2015 18:15:00 +0100
From:  ligustri rolando 
Subject:  comet C/2014 Q2 Lovejoy 11/03/15
http://www.astrobin.com/163130/

continuous monitoring of the comet. After 4 days, while using the same exposure, the
tail has lost a lot of brightness. In the field of 155 ' x 205 ' over the Comet is
visible the Nebula Sh2-188, the cluster M103 at the top and bottom right the cluster
Ngc457 or ' Owl ' cluster

best regards
Rolando Ligustri
===============================
C.A.R.A. http://cara.uai.it
CAST: Circolo AStrofili Talmassons
www.castfvg.it/fotoccd.htm#comete

Date:  Fri, 13 Mar 2015 03:24:54 +0100
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  Image C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) on Jan.25
Object/Date:C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) @ 2015-Jan-25
Tech data:Takahashi Takahashi FSQ-106ED refractor + SBIG STL-11000M camera 2x(L:1×300 Bin1 + RGB:1x60 Bin2)
Description:Comet C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) imaged on January 25, 2015 into a field of 4.5 deg lenght and 2 deg width. The tail still showing structures in spite of seems less active than previous days. Under comet head there is a cluster of small galaxies, being the brightest NGC 1060.
Location:Remotely from Mayhill, New Mexico (USA)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/2014q2-lovejoy-25ene2015/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo

Date:  Fri, 20 Mar 2015 00:07:56 +0100
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) on March 16
Object/Date:C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) @ 2015-Mar-16
Description:Comet C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) on March 16, 2015 imaged at its maximum approach to Ruchbah star (delta cassiopeiae), the angular distance between them was 9 arcminutes. The strong blue brightness of the star leaves barely visible the comet tail that extends from greenish coma toward northeast outside of image field.
Tech data:Planewave 20" CDK reflector & FLI-PL11002M camera
Location:Remotely from Mayhill, New Mexico (USA)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/verde_sobre_azul

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo 

Date:  Fri, 20 Mar 2015 09:27:35 -0000

http://martinmobberley.co.uk/Comets.html 

Date:  Fri, 20 Mar 2015 19:19:08 +0100
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  88P/Howell on March 19
Object/Date:88P/Howell @ 2015-03-19
Tech data:Planewave 20" CDK f/4.5 reflector + FLI-PL6303E camera (L:1×120 Bin1 + RGB:1x60 Bin2)
Description:Comet 88P/Howell imaged on March 19, 2015. With a magnitude near 10.5 is a bit less bright than expected. Shows a coma of 5' diameter and a ionic tail of 8' long toward west.
Location:Remotely from Siding Spring (Australia)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/88p-howell-19mar2015/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo

From:  Michael Jaeger 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] 2014 Q2 March 19 color
Thank you Chris. It is a good time for longer exposures. The movement in the tail is not rapidly.
Michael

On Fri, 3/20/15, José J. Chambó jjchambo@hotmail.com [Comet-Images] wrote:

Subject: [Comet-Images] 88P/Howell on March 19
To: "Comet images"
Date: Friday, March 20, 2015, 11:19 AM

Object/Date:88P/Howell @
2015-03-19
Tech data:Planewave 20" CDK f/4.5
reflector + FLI-PL6303E camera (L:1×120 Bin1 + RGB:1x60
Bin2)
Description:Comet 88P/Howell imaged on
March 19, 2015. With a magnitude near 10.5 is a bit less
bright than expected. Shows a coma of 5' diameter and a
ionic tail of 8' long toward west.
Location:Remotely from Siding Spring
(Australia)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/88p-howell-19mar2015/

Regards.
José
J. Chambó (Valencia,
Spain)blog: cometografia.es
twitter: @PepeChambo

Date:  Mon, 23 Mar 2015 10:13:03 -0700
From:  jbrimaco@bigpond.net.au
Subject:  Comet C/2014 Q2 Lovejoy Passes the Star Rukbah and the Open Clusters M103 and NGC 663 in Cassiopeia Widefield L Negative - March 17, 2015
Taken from New Mexico Skies Observatory using an FSQ 106 telescope and STL-6303 camera on a PME II mount with AOL guiding.
Time: 03h 59m UT; 1 x 60 min exposure.

LINKS
Positive image: https://www.flickr.com/photos/43846774@N02/16902567755/
Negative image: https://www.flickr.com/photos/43846774@N02/16716418639/
False color image: https://www.flickr.com/photos/43846774@N02/16876671566/

Clear, still skies
Joe

Joseph Brimacombe
Coral Towers Observatory

Cairns, Australia

Date:  Sun, 29 Mar 2015 12:10:03 +0200
From:  ligustri rolando 
Subject:  comet C/2013 A1 Siding Spring near M92
http://www.astrobin.com/full/168331/0/

best regards
Rolando Ligustri 

Date:  Sun, 29 Mar 2015 12:07:49 +0000
From:  amar sharma 
Subject:  C/2013 A1 Siding Spring rendezvous with M92
Hello comet imagers,
I got very lucky today when I happened to notice last moment in Cartes du Ciel (only by 5 am!) that A1 SS was placed *right beside* M92, and not even a little farther. I *was* to capture this shot which is why it happened today and I was already at our observatory, what a stroke of luck.
Single shot of 120s unguided. Unfiltered. Binning 2x2. CCD temperature -5*C. Flat, bias, dark applied (even then a couple pixels seen). Sky quality okay, not quite dark, some background glow from light pollution always there at our site.

For a long time I would dream & drool several years ago seeing Seiichi Yoshida's webpage [aerith.net] and wanting to image CCD comet + DSO rendezvous like these. This should be my first ccd rendezvous, captured today!
Mr Yoshida can use this image to display in his website, if he may.
Thank you, Amar.
Date:  Sun, 29 Mar 2015 12:07:47 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] C/2013 A1 Siding Spring rendezvous with M92 [1 Attachment]
Killer shot, the comet is moving so very slow, good news for us!

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

--------------------------------------------
On Sun, 3/29/15, amar sharma amar10sharmaa@yahoo.co.in [Comet-Images] wrote:

Subject: [Comet-Images] C/2013 A1 Siding Spring rendezvous with M92 [1 Attachment]
To: "Comet Images"
Cc: "comet@aerith.net"
Date: Sunday, March 29, 2015, 5:07 AM

[Attachment(s) from amar sharma included
below]

Hello comet
imagers,
I got very
lucky today when I happened to notice last moment in Cartes
du Ciel (only by 5 am!) that A1 SS was placed *right beside*
M92, and not even a little farther. I *was* to capture
this shot which is why it happened today and I was already
at our observatory, what a stroke of luck.
Single
shot of 120s unguided. Unfiltered. Binning 2x2. CCD
temperature -5*C. Flat, bias, dark applied (even then a
couple pixels seen). Sky quality okay, not quite dark, some
background glow from light pollution always there at our
site.

For a long
time I would dream & drool several years ago seeing
Seiichi Yoshida's webpage [aerith.net] and wanting to
image CCD comet + DSO rendezvous like these. This should be
my first ccd rendezvous, captured today!
Mr Yoshida
can use this image to display in his website, if he
may.
Thank you, Amar.

Date:  Tue, 31 Mar 2015 08:17:23 +1100
From:  Rob Kaufman 
Subject:  C/2013 US10 (Catalina), 30 Mar 2015
C/2013 US10 (Catalina) this morning, 30 March 2015 UT (31 March local).
Tough shooting - low altitude, early twilight and smoke from extensive
fuel-reduction burns in the air.

Cheers -

Rob Kaufman
Bright, Victoria, Australia 
Date:  Mon, 30 Mar 2015 16:31:52 -0500
From:  Bob King 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] C/2013 US10 (Catalina), 30 Mar 2015 [1 Attachment]
Very nice work Rob under difficult circumstances. A quiet beginning for a
potentially excellent comet.
Thanks,
Bob

From:  jean-gabriel bosch

Subject:  comet C/2014 Q2 at 08/04/2015 from NM
had to be in color, but the arrival of clouds does not have permission to do the RGB
files. However it is interesting to see the extent of the tail that even now it is
more than 2 degrees (probably more) and the dust tail that is pretty obvious. the
field shown here is 120'x180 '

http://www.astrobin.com/170707/

Date:  Wed, 15 Apr 2015 07:00:03 +0000
From:  Soulier Jean-FranÃ§ois 
Subject:  Observations of comets 2015 04 14 and 15
Good morning.

T400RC Remote, SpaceObs., A.Maury, Chile :

67P Churyumov Gerasimenko, ré-Observation.
Difficult conditions. Nevertheless, by taking over the 10 latest images
from J-Gabriel Bosch yesterday and those I made this morning
it happens with the Remote T400RC, align an arc of 4 lines of measures between 13 and 14/04.
The m2 of 67P with a measuring beam of 4.8" is 16.8 (+/-0.2), so 1 mag less than estimated.
The coma is difficult to measure the A. Mass very high.
Still, there must be at +/-10".
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/image67PChuryumovGerasimenkoChile.htm

29P S-W1
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/image29PschwassmannwachmannChile.html

C 2015 F4 Jacques
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/imageC2015F4JacquesChile.htm

T300 France :

C 2006 S3 Loneos
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/imageC2006S3loneosfrance.htm

C 2013 V5 Oukaimeden
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/imageC2013V5Oukaimedenfrance.htm

C 2012 K8 Lemmon
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/imageC2012K8Lemmonfrance.htm

C 2015 F3 Swan
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/imageC2015F3Swanfrance.htm

C 2014 Q2 Lovejoy
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/imageC2014Q2Lovejoyfrance.htm

Sincerely.SOULIER Jean-FrançoisC10/France

From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] C/2013 A1
Juanjo - thats a really deep image of the comet! surprisingly curved tail still. I can see from your star images you combined with either median or sigma. that method is very powerful for revealing such faint tail details. Very well done!

Chris Schur

Telescope tracking on comet67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko

Date:  Fri, 24 Apr 2015 21:34:15 +0200
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2015 F5 (SWAN-Xingming) on April 19
Object/Date:C/2015 F5 (SWAN-Xingming) @ 2015-Apr-19
Description:Comet C/2015 F5 (SWAN-Xingming) imaged on April 19, 2015, two weeks afterwards of be discovered. Whit a brightness at 10 magnitude shows a coma 3' wide and a intense blue color.
Location:Vallés, Valencia (Spain) Tech data:GSO 8" @ f/3,8 reflector & Canon EOS-100D camera (11x60 sec. at ISO 800)
Post link:http://cometografia.es/2015f5-swan-xingming-19abr2015/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo 

Date:  Sun, 26 Apr 2015 00:49:15 -0700

Regards
Michael Jäger

Date:  Mon, 27 Apr 2015 15:06:40 +0200
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  88P/Howell on April 1st
Object/Date:88P/Howell @ 2015-04-01
Tech data:Planewave 20" CDK f/4.4 reflector + FLI PL09000 camera (L:1×120 Bin1 + RGB:1x60 Bin2)
Description:Comet 88P/Howell imaged on April 1st 2015, with a brightness around 10 magnitude shows a greenish coma of 5' diameter and a short ionic tail toward southwest.
Location:Remotely from Siding Spring (Australia)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/88p-howell-1abr2015/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo 

Date:  Tue, 28 Apr 2015 04:02:35 +0000
From:  John Nassr 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] 88P/Howell on April 1st

Date:  Thu, 30 Apr 2015 05:01:29 -0700
From:  jbrimaco@bigpond.net.au
Subject:  Comet C/2014 Q2 Lovejoy Near the Open Cluster NGC 654 Widefield - March 25, 2015
Taken from New Mexico Skies Observatory using an FSQ 106 telescope and STL-11000 camera on a PME II mount with AOL guiding.
Time: 03h 30m UT; 1 x 60 min exposure.

LINKS
Positive image: https://www.flickr.com/photos/43846774@N02/17291291426/
Negative image: https://www.flickr.com/photos/43846774@N02/17317251155/
False color image: https://www.flickr.com/photos/43846774@N02/16694811734/

Clear, still skies
Joe

Joseph Brimacombe
Coral Towers Observatory

Cairns, Australia

Date:  Sat, 02 May 2015 08:29:06 -0600
From:  Alan Hale 
Subject:  Book update
Hello everyone,

Last month I finished a complete re-write of the manuscript; over 430 pages
long, although there are a lot of illustrations. Right now I'm in the
process of tying up as many of the loose ends as I can. The manuscript goes
to the proofreaders later this week . . . and at this point things are still
looking good for a July 23 release date (at least for the e-book version;
any print version will probably take longer).

I have been in private contact with several of you concerning using your
photos and images, and I here want to give a public "thank you!" to all of
you who have let me use your images. The book is a *much* better book with
these images than it ever would have been without them.

There are two people I am still trying to track down regarding usage of
photos, so I am issuing a general appeal to any of you who might be in a
position to help me find these individuals. I will be grateful for any help
you can provide!

Especially for those of you in Europe: I am trying to track down Claude
Nicollier, who took an absolutely beautiful photo of Comet Bennett over the
Swiss Alps in March 1970 (from matching the star fields, I believe the date
was March 26). I know that he was an astronaut for ESA for many years, but
he retired from ESA some years ago. (I've contacted ESA, and they tell me
they can't help me in tracking him down.) According to his ESA bio, he is
currently teaching at the Ecole Polytechnique Federale de Lausanne, and I
have contacted them, but other than a generic acknowledgement of my request
I have heard nothing back.

Especially for those of you in Australia/New Zealand: I am trying to track
down Merv Jones, who took a photo of Comet Tago-Sato-Kosaka that was
published in Sky & Telescope that I would like to use. He lived in
Marysborough, Queensland, and was an active comet and variable star
observer, and was one of the co-discoverers of Comet Mitchell-Jones-Gerber
in 1967. I've been in private contact with a couple of you (and other folks
as well) about trying to find him, but everything has come up empty so far,
and I have no idea whether or not he's even still alive. So, I'm issuing a
broader appeal . . .

Sincerely,
Alan

> 

Date:  Sat, 02 May 2015 22:57:33 +0100

Sergei Schmalz

Subject:  Observation of comets 20150503 at 05
Good morning.

Dear all
2 comets observed before moonrise:

C/2013 A1 (Siding Spring) curved tail 10 arcmin long, starting in
PA=160� near the nucleus, ending in PA=125� at 10 arcmin
http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/C2013A1_Siding_Spring.html

C/2015 F3 (SWAN) very diffuse
http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/C2015F3_SWAN.html

Best
Luc

Date:  Mon, 11 May 2015 12:53:05 +0100
From:  Μanos Kardasis 
Subject:  29P/Schwassmann-Wachmann 2015/05/09 outburst
Hello, here is an image of 29p outburst:

http://www.hellas-astro.gr/sites/default/files/images/observations/comets/2015-05-09-00-57-05-2015-05-09-01-14-23_1984.jpg

the coma size is 26 arcsec, about the maximum apparent size of Mars during optimal apparitions.

  Manos

Date:  Wed, 13 May 2015 10:55:52 -0700
From:  Lucian Hudin 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] C23 -NEW images 12-13 May 2015 :
C/2015 F3 (Swan) from L04 observatory, Cluj-Napoca, about 19 minutes of integration time, 0.3m f/5, kaf8300 bin2, in really good seeing, still no way to determine the centroid (1.47"/pixel).

http://www.astrophoto.ro/tmp/C2015F3_0511.jpg

Date:  Wed, 13 May 2015 22:23:04 +0200
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  88P/Howell on April 27
Object/Date:88P/Howell @ 2015-04-27
Tech data:Planewave 20" CDK f/4.5 reflector + FLI-PL6303E camera (L:1×120 Bin1 + RGB:1x60 Bin2)
Description:Comet 88P/Howell imaged on April 27, 2015 five days before perihelion when reached its maximum brightness around 9.5 magnitude, shows a green coma of 4' diameter and a outset tail very faint toward southwest.
Location:Remotely from Siding Spring (Australia)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/88p-howell-27abr2015/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo

Date:  Wed, 27 May 2015 09:25:01 +0200
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2014 Q2 on May 23
Object/Date:C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) @ 2015-05-23
Tech data:Takahashi FSQ 106mm f/5 refractor + SBIG STL-1100M camera (L:3×300 Bin1 + RGB:1x60 Bin2)
Description:Comet C/2014 (Lovejoy) imaged on May 23, 2015 when was at 2.5 deg from Polaris and above the IFN background (Integrated Flux Nebulosity). In spite of the comet has moved away until more than 2 A.U. from the Sun and Earth descending to 8 magnitude, still shows a ionic tail of 45' longitude toward northwest, and a short anti-tail toward east.
Location:Remotely from Mayhill, New Mexico (USA)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/lovejoy-bajo-polar/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo

Date:  Tue, 02 Jun 2015 19:53:07 +0200
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2014 Q2 on May 29
Object/Date:Comet C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) @ 2015-May-29
Description:Comet C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) just at its maximum approaching to Polaris star separated by 1 deg, imaged on May 29, 2015. Its brightness has dropped until 8th magnitude, meanwhile coma has lost intensity in its green tone. The image no reveals the everytime more faint ionic tail, surely because was taken from a suburban sky; nevertheless seems show something of dust tail toward northeast.
Location:Vallés, Valencia (Spain) Tech data:GSO 8" @ f/3,8 reflector & Canon EOS-100D camera
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/lovejoy-polar/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo

Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] C23 -NEW images 04 June 2015 :
Alfons - stunning image of Lovejoy, both tails are seen very clearly. So near the pole now, its behind the top of our observatories roof, which rolls off as you might expect - to the north!

Date:  Sun, 14 Jun 2015 06:54:08 -0600
From:  Alan Hale 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] C/2014Q1 Panstarrs, C/2015F4 Jacques, C2014W9 Panstarrs
Hi Gerald,

The images of C/2014 Q1 and C/2015 F4 are both beautiful. I have just posted
in comets-ml my visual report of C/2014 Q1 this morning; I could see the
central coma easily enough, but the sky was too bright for me to see the
tail.

Alan

Hi Gerald,

The images of C/2014 Q1 and C/2015 F4 are both beautiful. I have just posted
in comets-ml my visual report of C/2014 Q1 this morning; I could see the
central coma easily enough, but the sky was too bright for me to see the
tail.

Date:  Fri, 19 Jun 2015 12:58:04 +0200
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2014 G2 on Jun 8
Object/Date:C/2015 G2 (MASTER) @ 2015-Jun-08
Tech data:Planewave 20" CDK f/4.4 reflector & FLI PL09000 camera (L:1×180 Bin1 + RGB:1x60 Bin2)
Description:Comet C/2015 G2 MASTER imaged on June 8, 2015 after passing its perihelion and having lowered its brightness until the 8th magnitude, still shows toward southeast a very weakened ion tail at side of a faint dust tail, more short and wide, wich was developed at the beginning of June.
Location:Remotely from Siding Spring (Australia)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/2015g2-master-8jun2015/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo

Hello everybody,

Here is an image of 2013US10 near 7 mag Star and Galaxy NGC7793:

http://www.astrostudio.at/2_Bright%20Comets.php?img=images/2_Bright%20Comets

Comet 67P and a have a look at the blue red yellow star trail at the left -
it is minor planet 16 Psyche:

http://www.astrostudio.at/3_Faint%20Comets.php?img=images/3_Faint%20Comets/1
78_67P.jpg

Comet 2015F4 looks unchanged but coma looks more greenish:

http://www.astrostudio.at/3_Faint%20Comets.php?img=images/3_Faint%20Comets/1
79_2015F4_2.jpg

Date:  Fri, 26 Jun 2015 13:06:29 +0200
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  67P on Jun 24
Object/Date:67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko @ Jun.24,2015
Tech data:Planewave 20" CDK f/4.4 reflector & FLI PL09000 camera (L:1×120s Bin1 + RGB:1x60s Bin2)
Description:Image of the periodic comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko taken on June 24, 2015 entering to inner Solar Sistem with a brightness still near magnitude 14,5. I think is the first taken in color. The geometry of this apparition of comet 67P is very unfavorable for be observed from Earth being always at low altitude above horizon. In spite of difficulties for take the image shows a tail of 5' long, and with more contrast can be detected a greenish envelope of 1,5' diameter around a small inner coma whitish and very condensed in which is located the Rosetta probe orbiting the comet nucleus.
Location:Remotely from Siding Spring (Australia)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/67p-churyumov-gerasimenko-24jun2015/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo

On Friday, June 26, 2015 3:35 PM, "'Gerald Rhemann' gerald.rhemann@gmail.com [Comet-Images]" wrote:

Hello everybody,

Here is an image of 2013US10 near 7 mag Star and Galaxy NGC7793:

http://www.astrostudio.at/2_Bright%20Comets.php?img=images/2_Bright%20Comets/296_2013US10.jpg

Comet 67P and a have a look at the blue red yellow star trail at the left – it is minor planet 16 Psyche:

http://www.astrostudio.at/3_Faint%20Comets.php?img=images/3_Faint%20Comets/178_67P.jpg

Comet 2015F4 looks unchanged but coma looks more greenish:

http://www.astrostudio.at/3_Faint%20Comets.php?img=images/3_Faint%20Comets/179_2015F4_2.jpg

2012X1 is faint:

http://www.astrostudio.at/3_Faint%20Comets.php?img=images/3_Faint%20Comets/180_2012X1.jpg

regards

Gerald

Date:  Sat, 04 Jul 2015 16:41:31 -0700
From:  michaeljaeger@gmx.at
Subject:  C/2014 Q1 Elongation 10°
Hello

Comet is now 4 mag bright.
Observation under extreme conditions with mobile equipment.from mountain location

10 degrees elongation, 45 minutes after sunset.
Jul 4 UT 19.45
10"/4.0 FLI 8300

30x1 sec red
10x1 21x2 8x3 UV/IR

some clouds and haze sky at horizon

Regards
Michael Jäger

http://spaceweathergallery.com/indiv_upload.php?upload_id=114848 http://spaceweathergallery.com/indiv_upload.php?upload_id=114848

large

http://spaceweathergallery.com/full_image.php?image_name=Michael-JAcger-2014q120150704UT1945sweb_1436051865.jpg http://spaceweathergallery.com/full_image.php?image_name=Michael-JAcger-2014q120150704UT1945sweb_1436051865.jpg

Date:  Wed, 08 Jul 2015 02:18:43 +0200
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) on June-19
Object/Date:Comet C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) @ 2015-June-19
Description:Comet C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) imaged on June 19, 2015 a few days before Earth intersect its orbital plane, in this image it could see the "anti-tail" more brilliant toward northwest formed by heaviest dust particles, while the "normal" dust tail is barely visible very faint with wide and short shaped toward southeast.
Location:Hoya Redonda, Valencia (Spain) Tech data:GSO 8" @ f/3,8 reflector & Canon EOS-100D camera (9x120 sec. at ISO 1600)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/2014q2-lovejoy-19jun2015/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo 

Date:  Wed, 08 Jul 2015 06:45:39 -0700
From:  martin.gembec@gmail.com
Subject:  C/2014 Q1 (PanSTARRS)
When I have seen Michael's image I was very surprised how great comet looks. So I decided to try image it too. But weather conditions and location were not good for me. I used computer controlled SCT 11" and Canon 30D. I hope, if I catch Castor, I can try comet position also. Luckilly it was possible but I haven't seen anything on display. Today I found comet on many of my lucky images, but comet was visible very poor near corner of images. I found three, where comet is near center and luckyly between haze bands. So there is an image and animation of this very hard object. My friend sad twice that he was see it through 125 mm binoculars, but it were only moments, maybe in the same situation, when comet was between haze/cloud bands.

http://udalosti.astronomy.cz/wp-content/2014q1panstarrs-20150706.jpg http://udalosti.astronomy.cz/wp-content/2014q1panstarrs-20150706.jpg

http://udalosti.astronomy.cz/wp-content/2014q1panstarrs-20150706.jpg

http://udalosti.astronomy.cz/wp-content/2014q1panstarrs-... http://udalosti.astronomy.cz/wp-content/2014q1panstarrs-20150706.jpg

View on udalosti.astronomy.cz http://udalosti.astronomy.cz/wp-content/2014q1panstarrs-20150706.jpg
Preview by Yahoo

http://udalosti.astronomy.cz/wp-content/q1-animace.gif http://udalosti.astronomy.cz/wp-content/q1-animace.gif

http://udalosti.astronomy.cz/wp-content/q1-animace.gif

http://udalosti.astronomy.cz/wp-content/q1-animace.gif http://udalosti.astronomy.cz/wp-content/q1-animace.gif

View on udalosti.astronomy.cz http://udalosti.astronomy.cz/wp-content/q1-animace.gif

Date:  Fri, 10 Jul 2015 11:42:17 +0200
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2013 US10 (Catalina) on June-22
Object/Date:C/2013 US10 (Catalina) @ 2015-04-27
Tech data:Planewave 20" CDK f/4.5 reflector + FLI-PL6303E camera (L:2×120s Bin1)
Description:Comet C/2013 US10 (Catalina) imaged on June 22, 2015 approaching to 23' at north of the spiral barred galaxy NGC 7723 and on a background with tens of tiny galaxies in the Aquarius constellation. Comet C/2013 US10 (Catalina), that is here around 10.5 magnitude and shows a short dust tail, will increase its brightness until reach magnitude 6 at the beginning of 2016.
Location:Remotely from Siding Spring (Australia)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/2013us10-catalina-22jun2015/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo

Subject:  51P the end ?
Hello all,
51P gives the impression of disintegrating in the picture this morning.
After its multiple fragmentations could this be the end of the comet approaching the perihelion?
remote T400RC SpaceObs Maury. A

51P Harrington

Date:  Mon, 13 Jul 2015 22:37:51 +0200
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2013 US10 (Catalina) on June-24
Object/Date:C/2013 US10 (Catalina) @ Jun.24,2015
Tech data:Planewave 20" CDK f/4.4 reflector & FLI PL09000 camera (L:3×120s Bin1 + RGB:1x60s Bin2)
Description:Comet C/2013 US10 (Catalina) imaged on June 24, 2015 placed to an angular distance of 28' from the spiral barred galaxy NGC 7793 and on a background with tens of tiny galaxies in the constellation of Aquarius. Unlike which I took two days ago, in this I could take the necessary shots for compose a color image. Aside from a esthetic improvement, in this version highlights a coma with strong greenish tone, as well as a halo of same color that extends until a diameter of 6'.
Location:Remotely from Siding Spring (Australia)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/2013us10-catalina-24jun2015/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo 

Date:  Tue, 14 Jul 2015 18:01:12 +0200
From:  Martin Mašek 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] 51P the end ?
I've tried to observe 51P/Harrington on telescope FRAM (MPC I47) on 14.4
July 2015. The comet is not visible on stacked image
(4×60
sec exposure, R filter). The faintest stars on image are about 18.3
magnitude.

Clear skies!
Martin Masek

2015-07-13 17:11 GMT+02:00 jean-gabriel bosch jeangabriel_bosch@yahoo.com

Date:  Wed, 15 Jul 2015 02:53:34 +0200
From:  Martin Mašek 
Subject:  C/2014 Q1, 14th July 2015
There is an image of comet C/2014 Q1 (Panstarrs)

from telescope FRAM (MPC I47), 14th July 2015, 22:38 - 22:47 UT. 300mm
Nikkor lens + CCD MII G4-16000, 10×10 sec in V and R filter. Very clear sky.

Best regards,
Martin Masek 
Date:  Wed, 15 Jul 2015 06:45:50 +0000
From:  Hidetaka Sato 
Subject:  51P declined
Hi, Jean, Martin and all
I imaged 51P at July 14.5 on iTelescope SRO (California).It was moderately condensed but elongated westwards (coma of 8" x 15").I estimated the w-band total magnitude as 18.6 (within a circular aperture of radius 7.6).
https://picasaweb.google.com/104133965506763777371/PICASA#6171621603162012514
regardsHidetaka SatoTokyo, Japan
Date:  Wed, 15 Jul 2015 12:09:03 +0200

Subject:  C23 -NEW images *** NEW COMET / C2015 M3 PANSTARRS


06-10-11 July 2015

*** NEW COMET

C2015 M3 PANSTARRS - 06 July 2015
C2015 M3 PANSTARRS - 10 July 2015
C2015 M3 PANSTARRS - 11 July 2015

with a direct link to the image:
http://www.astronomie.be/alfons.diepvens/cometimages/index.html

Alfons Diepvens

Date:  Sun, 19 Jul 2015 23:09:41 +1000
From:  mmatti@westnet.com.au
Subject:  C/2014 Q1 PANSTARRS 2015 July 19
Hi Folks,

My observation and images of C/2014 Q1 PANSTARRS.
2015 July 19 at 08:50UT.
Comet appeared magnitude 4.9 through 8x40mm binoculars.
Comet was barely detectable with the naked eye due to moonlight.
Visual tail lengths through 25x100mm binoculars:
2 degree long ion tail (type I) superimposed on a 1 degree dust tail (type
II) in PA 104 and a 1 degree long dust trail (type III) in PA 23....
The photographic length of the ion tail is >4.5 degrees.

A very photogenic comet!

http://spaceweathergallery.com/indiv_upload.php?upload_id=115384.

cheers,
Michael Mattiazzo
Swan Hill, Victoria, Australia 
Date:  Sun, 19 Jul 2015 13:02:38 -0700

Back at Austria on jul 24

Regards MJ

From:  Luc ARNOLD 
Subject:  2015-07-21 morning  57P 61P
Hi all
Second visit to a pair of comets this morning:

57P is a very nice object - would deserve a longer exposure with a
larger telescope:-)
57P/Du Toit-Neujmin-Delporte, sloan CLR Tail >15 arcmin in PA=248�
http://www.obs-hp.fr//Lu/57P_Du_Toit-Neujmin-Delporte.html

61P/Shajn-Schaldach, CLR, Tail >1 arcmin in PA=250�
http://www.obs-hp.fr//v2/LucArnold/61P_Shajn-Schaldach.html
I observed 61P during 20 minutes just before the nautical twilight, and
the sky was brighter than during my previous observation.

Best
Luc

Date:  Wed, 22 Jul 2015 15:39:15 +0200
From:  Bernhard Häusler 
Subject:  image of C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) on July,21 2015 and more...
Dear collegues,

the single discovery of a new asteroid is nothing particularly among you and the same for me in comparison to the fine work of many
guys here.
Nevertheless, it happens quite seldom that such an amateur discovery undergoes a wide media coverage, as the discovery of the
asteroid (410928) Maidbronn.
Anyway, my amateur work was accessible to a broad public this year and my "Astronomy Day" was very elongated in 2015.

Here you find some informations and links to asteroid Maidbronn:
http://www.b82maidbronn.de/p2008o2.htm
http://www.b82maidbronn.de/410928_maidbronn.htm

If anyone of you has the opportunity to receive the German / French " Arte" culture program via European satellite ASTRA, I
recommend the program X:enius with the broadcast "Infinite Universe - also limitless view?" on August,8 2015 at 06:30UT and 17:00UT.
My balcony observatory B82 Maidbronn and the discovery of Asteroid Maidbronn will play a role in the broadcast, sent in German and
French.
In this context I would like to mention here the cooperation with Josep M. Bosch and Antonio Garrigós Sánchez from Spain, which were
a great help for me in confirming the discovery of asteroid Maidbronn in 2009.

A new image of C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) on July,21 2015 you find here:
http://www.b82maidbronn.de/c2014q2_20150721.htm
and the last images of this comet on:
http://www.b82maidbronn.de/c2014q2.htm

By chance I still looked at the NEO confirmation page last night and that came out:
http://www.b82maidbronn.de/lm01pwu.htm
On the page is a stacked image of 60 Minutes exposure time and a .gif animation of two crossing asteroids, one of them a main belt
object, the other the NEO LM01PWu

Clear skies
Bernhard

http://www.b82maidbronn.de/index.htm

Date:  Thu, 23 Jul 2015 21:27:39 +1000
From:  Michael Mattiazzo 
Subject:  C/2014 Q1 PANSTARRS July 23 09:00UT
Hi all

Just updated my website with a photo of Comet C/2014 Q1 PANSTARRS taken July
23 at 09:00UT

http://members.westnet.com.au/mmatti/sc.htm

comet is fading rather quickly and appears magnitude 5.9 through 8x40mm
binoculars
Through 25x100mm binoculars, coma is 4' wide with twin dust tails 1 deg in
PA 115 and 0.5 deg in PA 35
which are becoming more difficult to observe in Moonlight.

cheers,
Michael Mattiazzo
Swan Hill, Victoria

From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Comet Lovejoy C2014 Q2 finally cleared the roof
THat is the problem with a roll off roof - the northern sky is blocked. Now the comet is just far enough to clear, a break in the monsoon let us get a shot of this nice object, and a few of the comet conjunction, which Im still working on. So here is last nights shot:

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/Lovejoy072215.html

Date:  Thu, 23 Jul 2015 15:44:15 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Comet Jacques C/2015F4 and M27 closest approach last night....
Greetings all,

Last night was the first clear night in over a month since the Arizona monsoon started in june. AND it was also when comet Jacques passed 1.5 degrees from M27 at 8pm or so. Sometimes things just work out for us dedicated comet imagers! Here is my shot from last night, hot off the photoshop press:

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/Jacques072215.html

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

>
> Hello
>
> Back home. First image i could present was taken on Jul. 14 UT 17.15
>
> with 5"/f-8 Starfire and Moravian G3-11002 L-8x30sec 2x2 bin and RGB
> 30/40/50sec
>
> Comet was at 18,5 Elongation and in brighter sky.
>
> Further images in the next few days
>
> http://spaceweathergallery.com/full_image.php?image_name=Michael-JAcger-2014q1jul14lrgblastweb_1437842539.jpg
>
> Regards
>
> MJ
> 
Date:  Sat, 25 Jul 2015 12:51:43 -0700
From:  mfortsm@aol.com
Subject:  Re: C/2014 Q1 Jul 14 LRGB
Thats really nice and looks like a bright sky. Been lots of Q1's over the years it seems like.
Date:  Sat, 25 Jul 2015 15:51:41 -0700
From:  michaeljaeger@gmx.at
Subject:  C/2014 Q1 Moon Venus Jupiter widefield Jul 18
Hello

It was a grandiose view. Crescent moon, Venus and Jupiter and the 5m0 bright PanStarrs. Unfortunately I did not have much time for a longer visual observation this scene. In the observatory I had to use the FSQ for detailed shots.. At the same time ran the 50mm lens with the FLI CCD camera
That made a lot of stress.I can now present the image with the normal lens.
Thank you all for the kind comments

LRGB

http://spaceweathergallery.com/indiv_upload.php?upload_id=115606 http://spaceweathergallery.com/indiv_upload.php?upload_id=115606

bw

http://spaceweathergallery.com/full_image.php?image_name=Michael-JAcger-2014q1jul18jaeger_1437863896.jpg http://spaceweathergallery.com/full_image.php?image_name=Michael-JAcger-2014q1jul18jaeger_1437863896.jpg

Bestz Regards
MJ

Date:  Mon, 27 Jul 2015 12:59:06 -0700
From:  michaeljaeger@gmx.at
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] comet C/2013 US10 Catalina, today from AU, large field
Good job Rolando

It looks like 2012 K1 before perihelion. But it is better for us after november
I observed it beetween juli 14-23 at Namibia. The ion tail in some nights was brighter and than very faint but >2°
Image taken on Jul 23 with 8"/4-5 Newton

http://spaceweathergallery.com/full_image.php?image_name=Michael-JAcger-2013US10Jul23UT115web_1438026467.jpg http://spaceweathergallery.com/full_image.php?image_name=Michael-JAcger-2013US10Jul23UT115web_1438026467.jpg

A first sum picture shows a dramatic DE in the ion tail.

LRGB image may take a little longer.

Regards

7x100sec 2x120sec

Date:  Mon, 10 Aug 2015 19:39:00 -0600
From:  Alan Hale 
Subject:  my book
Hello everyone,

At long last my book, ³the comet man,² is available for general
distribution. I have it available (in PDF form) at the Earthrise web site,
http://www.earthriseinstitute.org/thecometman.html although that¹s really
for one-on-one sales (I will be handling all the transactions personally).
As of this afternoon the book is also available at the iTunes bookstore,
http://itunes.apple.com/us/book/id1028656594  that¹s in the U.S. bookstore,
but it is also available in the iTunes bookstore in all the other 50
countries that have such bookstores. I¹m also working on an Amazon Kindle
version, and I hope that that will be available by the end of the week.

Many of you helped out with the book, either with supplying images and/or
helping me dig up other information, and I thank all of you for that.
(You¹re personally thanked in the Acknowledgements page.) Writing this book
has been ³interesting,² and a rather cathartic experience. I hope everyone
who gets a copy and reads it gets something worthwhile out of it.

Sincerely,
Alan

> 

Date:  Tue, 11 Aug 2015 08:34:38 +0000
From:  Soulier Jean-FranÃ§ois 
Subject:  New comet and observation 20150811
Good morning.
T300 France :
3200 Phaèthon
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/image3200Phaetonfrance.htm
67P Churyumov-Gerasimenko
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/image67PChuryumovGerasimenkofrance.htm

T400RC Remote, SpaceObs., A.Maury, Chile :
C 2015 P3 Swan (new comet)
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/imageC2015P3SwanChile.htm
29P S-W1
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/image29PschwassmannwachmannChile.html
176P Linear (MBC), Very low detection limit.
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/image176PLinearChile.htm
Sincerely.
SOULIER Jean-François
C10/France

Date:  Tue, 11 Aug 2015 05:20:55 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) - One i forgot!
Damian, truly a remarkable image! I still dont know how you always seem to manage to get out all the left over median combine streaks when you produce the comet only image, but you have certainly mastered the technique.

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Date:  Tue, 11 Aug 2015 23:59:52 +0000
From:  John Nassr 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] C/2013 US10 (Catalina) - Aug 10th
Damian,
A beauty!

I recall your Nov 26, 2014 image taken with a 17" CDK. The comet exhibited a distinct tail at a distance of around 4.8AU. Then as the comet came closer, images captured only a diffused glow but no tail. The tail reemerged only recently as the comet approaches perihelion.

John

I recall your Nov 26, 2014 image taken with a 17" CDK. The comet exhibited a distinct tail at a distance of around 4.8AU. Then as the comet came closer, images captured only a diffused glow but no tail. The tail reemerged only recently as the comet approaches perihelion.

Date:  Wed, 12 Aug 2015 21:15:24 +0000
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet 67P - August 12th.
Hi all,
The view isnt quite as dramatic from 265 million km away but a short dust tail is nicely seen. The comet is less than a day from perihelion in this view so probably as good as the comet gets from our vantage point.
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/67p_2015_08_12dp.jpg
24"CDK with FLI camera. LRGB. 20/2/2/2min. N to left.

Best Wishes
Damian *************************************************
Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro
Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk
*************************************************

Hi all,
The view isnt quite as dramatic from 265 million km away but a short dust tail is nicely seen. The comet is less than a day from perihelion in this view so probably as good as the comet gets from our vantage point.
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/67p_2015_08_12dp.jpg
24"CDK with FLI camera. LRGB. 20/2/2/2min. N to left.

On Wed, 8/12/15, Damian Peach dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk [Comet-Images] wrote:

Subject: [Comet-Images] Comet 67P - August 12th.

clear:both;font-size:smaller;height:15px;overflow:hidden;text-align:center;width:75px;}
#yiv0429173707 div.yiv0429173707ygrp-photo{
background-position:center;background-repeat:no-repeat;background-color:white;border:1px
solid black;height:62px;width:62px;}

#yiv0429173707 div.yiv0429173707photo-title
a,
#yiv0429173707 div.yiv0429173707photo-title a:active,
#yiv0429173707 div.yiv0429173707photo-title a:hover,

text-decoration:none;
}

clear:both;}

clear:both;padding:15px 0 3px 0;overflow:hidden;}

width:30px;}

font-weight:bold;}
#yiv0429173707

Hi
all,
The view
isnt quite as dramatic from 265 million km away but a short
dust tail is nicely seen. The comet is less than a day from
perihelion in this view so probably as good as the comet
gets from our vantage point.
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/67p_2015_08_12dp.jpg
24"CDK
with FLI camera. LRGB. 20/2/2/2min. N to left.

Best
Wishes
Damian *************************************************
Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro
Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk
*************************************************

Date:  Tue, 18 Aug 2015 12:35:05 +0200
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) on July-18
Object/Date:Comet C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) @ July 18, 2015
Description:Comet C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) imaged on July 18, 2015 when it was as far as 2.7 A.U. from the Sun and Earth but keeping its brightness relatively high as yet around 9.5 magnitude. In the image shows a coma with a diameter of 7' and a tail of 15' long.
Location:Hoya Redonda, Valencia (Spain) Tech data:GSO 8" @ f/3,8 reflector & Canon EOS-100D camera (8x120 sec. at ISO 1600)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/2014q2-lovejoy-18jul2015/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo 

Date:  Tue, 18 Aug 2015 12:44:21 +0200

Subject:  2015-08-21 C2011KP36 C2015F4 K1 O1
Hi all

4 comets this evening

C/2011 KP36 Spacewatch, filter Sloan r'
http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/C2011KP36_Spacewatch.html

C/2015 F4 Jacques, filter Sloan r', tail > 6 arcmin between 149 et 182�
http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/C2015F4_Jacques.html

C/2015 K1 MASTER, CLR filter, tail > 7 arcmin in PA 224� (hint of
antitail in blinks - have to post an animated gif)
http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/C2015K1_MASTER.html

C/2015 O1 PANSTARRS, CLR filter
http://www.obs-hp.fr/~larnold/v2/LucArnold/C2015O1_PANSTARRS.html

Date:  Mon, 24 Aug 2015 14:48:47 -0600
From:  Alan Hale 
Subject:  Re: [comets-ml] my book
Hello everyone,

Just wanted to let everybody know that a slightly revised version (version
1.1, if you will) of my book is now available. I¹ve corrected a few
typographical errors and minor issues that I somehow managed to miss the
first dozen times I read through the manuscript.

If you already have the original version of the book and would like the
revised version, the same link and password that you already have will take
you to the new one (no cost). I¹ve submitted the revised version to the
iTunes Store, and that should be available in about 24 hours. I¹ve run into
a snag with the Amazon Kindle version and have to work out some formatting
issues, but hopefully that will be taken care of soon. Once that is done, I
will start exploring possibilities for a print version.

Sincerely,
Alan

Date:  Sun, 30 Aug 2015 23:46:46 +0200
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2013 US10 Catalina on Aug-8
Object/Date:C/2013 US10 (Catalina) @ Aug.8,2015
Description:Comet C/2013 US10 (Catalina) imaged on August 8, 2015 has increased its brightness more speedily than expected until 7th magnitude. Moreover of a short dust tail is developing a ionic tail, that spite of is seen faint in the image, is observed at least with 1.5 deg long.
Tech data:Takahashi FSQ ED 106mm. f/5.0 refractor & FLI ML16803 camera (L:1×300s Bin1 + RGB:1x60s Bin2) cropped
Location:Remotely from Siding Spring (Australia)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/2013us10-catalina-8ago2015/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo 

Date:  Mon, 31 Aug 2015 07:27:31 +0000

Subject:  Mosaic : 67P with 141P-A and -X, 20150831
Good morning.
This morning 67P was less than 45' 141P-A (and -X).
The opportunity to make a small mosaic ...
T300 France, 2x (6x40s) without filter :
http://6888comete.free.fr/images/forum/141P_A_X_67P_20150831.jpg
Zoom :
141P-A and -X Machholz
Le brocanteur des étoiles - métaphysique
67P Churyumov-Gerasimenko

Date:  Tue, 01 Sep 2015 07:51:57 +0000
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  C/2014 Q1 (PanSTARRS) - August 19th.
Hi all,
Here is C/2014 Q1 taken on August 19th. This time using the large 20" scope so a smaller FOV.
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2014_q1_2015_08_19dp.jpg
20"CDK with FLI camera. LRGB. 18/2/2/2mins. 20% crescent moon up but didn't cause any problems at this low illumination.
Best Wishes

From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  C/2013 US10 (Catalina) and allot of stars! - Sep 1st
Hi all,
The comet is presently passing through some very dense Milkyway star fields - really quite mind boggling the number of stars in this 40'x30' field.....
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2013_us10_2015_09_01dp.jpg
20"CDK with FLI camera. LRGB. 20/1/1/1mins.

Best Wishes
Damian

Date:  Thu, 03 Sep 2015 17:49:31 +0200
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2014 Q2 Lovejoy on Aug. 12
Object/Date:Comet C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) @ August 12, 2015
Description:Comet C/2014 Q2 (Lovejoy) imaged on August 12, 2015 at 3 A.U. from the Sun and Earth and with a brightness of 10th magnitude, still shows a tail of 15 min. long.
Location:Hoya Redonda, Valencia (Spain) Tech data:GSO 8" @ f/3,8 reflector & Canon EOS-100D camera (8x120 sec. at ISO 1600)
Location:Hoya Redonda, Valencia (Spain)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/2014q2-lovejoy-12ago2015/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo

background-position:center;background-repeat:no-repeat;background-color:white;border:1px
solid black;height:62px;width:62px;}

#yiv4211444919 div.yiv4211444919photo-title
a,
#yiv4211444919 div.yiv4211444919photo-title a:active,
#yiv4211444919 div.yiv4211444919photo-title a:hover,
#yiv4211444919 div.yiv4211444919photo-title a:visited {
text-decoration:none;
}

div.yiv4211444919attach-row {
clear:both;}

#yiv4211444919 div.yiv4211444919attach-table
div.yiv4211444919attach-row div {
float:left;}

#yiv4211444919 p {
clear:both;padding:15px 0 3px 0;overflow:hidden;}

width:30px;}

div.yiv4211444919attach-row div div a {
text-decoration:none;}

div.yiv4211444919attach-row div div span {
font-weight:normal;}

font-weight:bold;}

From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  C/2014 A4 (SONEAR) and allot of stars! - Sep 6th
Hi all,
Here is an image of C/2014 A4 which just passed perihelion. Its still a faint object however at 14th mag. Note the interesting kinked tail.
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2014_a4_2015_09_06dp.jpg
27"CDK with FLI camera. L filter. 10mins.

Date:  Mon, 07 Sep 2015 19:42:04 +0200
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2013 US10 Catalina on Aug-9
Object/Date:C/2013 US10 (Catalina) @ Aug.9,2015
Description:Comet C/2013 US10 (Catalina) imaged on August 9, 2015 with a bright coma of green color, indicatory of a strong gas emission of diatomic carbon C2, as well shows two tails: a remarkable dust tail to northeast (toward right top) and a faint ionic tail northwards (toward right).
Tech data:Planewave 20" CDK f/4.4 reflector & FLI PL09000 camera (LRGB:1x60s Bin1) cropped
Location:Remotely from Siding Spring (Australia)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/2013us10-catalina-9ago2015/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo

is reported at 16.4 N by A71 on 2015/08/18.88
but I measured it at 19.1 N tonight, on Sept. 7th)

Date:  Thu, 10 Sep 2015 12:57:52 +0000
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  C/2013 US10 (Catalina) with NGC 5822 (Sep 9th.)
Hi all,
Here is C/2013 US10 yesterday alongside open cluster NGC 5822 in Lupus. A mind boggling number of stars in this field of view!
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2013_us10_2015_09_09dp.jpg
FSQ106 with FLI CCD. LRGB. 20/2/2/2mins. Note stars close to nucleus giving it elongated appearance.

Best Wishes
Damian *************************************************

Subject:  2013US10 and NGC5822
Hello everybody,

This is a straight RGB mosaic of two fields. NGC 5822 is a very loose
cluster and do not attract attention if one do not point out - the cluster
is on the left side of the image :_)

Date:  Tue, 15 Sep 2015 09:12:47 +0200
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2014 Q1 PANSTARRS on Aug-11
Object/Date:C/2014 Q1 (PANSTARRS) @ Aug.11,2015
Description:Comet C/2013 Q1 (PANSTARRS) imaged on August 11, 2015. After its perihelion showed this unusual double dust tail: the "nominal" directed towards East with 1.5 degrees long, and the other towards North (upwards) with more than 2 degree long shaped by very heavy particles that were left behind in the orbital trajectory of the comet.
Tech data:Takahashi FSQ ED 106mm. f/5.0 refractor & FLI ML16803 camera (L:3×180s Bin1) cropped
Location:Remotely from Siding Spring (Australia)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/2014q1-panstarrs-11ago2015/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo

Date:  Wed, 16 Sep 2015 17:28:32 +0000
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  C/2014 Q1 with Centaurus A (Sep 16th.)
Hi all,
C/2014 Q1 is presently passing by the bright active galaxy NGC 5128. The comet dust tail has become narrow as we approach the orbital plane crossing. Also note near top left is a satellite flare - three different objects in the same frame at very different distances!
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/c2014_q1_2015_09_16dp.jpg
FSQ106 with FLI CCD. Luminance. 6x2mins.
Best Wishes
Damian

*************************************************
Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro
Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk
************************************************* 

Date:  Wed, 16 Sep 2015 20:46:25 +0200
From:  Bernhard Häusler 
Subject:  Reprocessing of old comet images of C/2006 P1 (McNaught)
Hi,

retrospect of the daylight comet C/2006 P1 (McNaught) with revised video of the true horizon sinking on January, 13 2007, one day after perihelion from Northern site.

http://www.b82maidbronn.de/c2006p1.htm

Observation storyboard included.

Clear skies

Bernhard

http://www.b82maidbronn.de/index.htm 

Date:  Thu, 17 Sep 2015 00:59:19 -0700
From:  jbrimaco@bigpond.net.au
Subject:  Comet C/2014 Q2 Lovejoy Widefield L - Sept 16, 2015
Taken from New Mexico Skies Observatory using an FSQ 106 telescope and STL-11000 camera on a PME II mount with AOL guiding.
Time: 03h 26m UT; 1 x 60 min exposure.

LINK
https://www.flickr.com/photos/43846774@N02/20862602474/

Joe

Date:  Mon, 21 Sep 2015 22:27:11 +0200
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2014 Q1 PANSTARRS on Aug-13
Object/Date:C/2014 Q1 (PANSTARRS) @ Aug.13,2015
Description:Comet C/2014 Q1 (PANSTARRS) imaged on August 13th 2015 this time in color, confirming the dusty nature of both white tails thrown by comet and the poor gas emission which is abridged to only the tiny coma where is detected the greenish color of diatomic carbon C2.
Tech data:Takahashi FSQ ED 106mm. f/5.0 refractor & FLI ML16803 camera (L:3×180 Bin1 + RGB:1x60 Bin2) cropped
Location:Remotely from Siding Spring (Australia)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/2014q1-panstarrs-20150813/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo 

Date:  Tue, 22 Sep 2015 01:04:04 +0200
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko on Aug-14
Object/Date:67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko @ Aug.14,2015
Description:Comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko imaged on August 14th 2015 right in its perihelion when began to be observable at low altitude before dawn from North Hemisphere and five days before it have an outburst. The comet has here a brightness near magnitude 12.5 showing a tiny and slightly greenish coma with a short and faint tail toward west.
Tech data:Planewave 20" CDK f/4.5 & FLI PL11002M (L:1×180 Bin1 + RGB:1x30 Bin2) cropped
Location:Remotely from Mayhill, New Mexico (USA)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/67p-churyumov-gerasimenko-20150814/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo

Date:  Tue, 22 Sep 2015 21:17:56 +0200
From:  Erik Bryssinck 
Subject:  comet 29P in outburst
After announcement of outburst of comet 29P, by Jean-François Soulier on the
Comet-ML, we checked our images taken today and days before, we can confirm
this outburst:

Image and data can you find via link below:

http://www.astronomie.be/erik.bryssinck/29p_20150922.html

Erik Bryssinck & Franz-Josef Hambsch

Date:  Tue, 22 Sep 2015 22:15:33 +0200
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2013 US10 (Catalina) on Sep-17
Object/Date:C/2013 US10 (Catalina) @ Sep.17,2015
Description:Comet C/2013 US10 (Catalina) imaged on September 17th 2015, with magnitude 6.5 is now observable using binoculars from the South Hemisphere. In this wide field photography the comet is located near the bright star Alpha Lupi into constellation of the Wolf. The coma shows a strong greenish emission of C2, meanwhile its dust tail is projected toward southeast with a longitude of more than 1.5 degrees that ends confusing inside the Milky Way which fills the bottom of image.
Tech data:Takahashi FSQ-106ED & SBIG STL-1100M (L:3×180 + RGB:1x120)
Location:Remotely from Siding Spring (Australia)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/2013us10-catalina-20150917/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo

Date:  Thu, 24 Sep 2015 19:24:22 +0200
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2014 S2 (PANSTARRS) on Sep-20
Object/Date:C/2014 S2 (PANSTARRS) @ Sep.20,2015
Description:Comet C/2014 S2 (PANSTARRS) imaged on September 20th 2015, has a brightness near magnitude 10.5 and shows a short dust tail of 3 min long. The bright star in the image pertains to the constellation of Cepheus and has magnitude 6.8.
Tech data:Planewave 24" CDK & FLI PL09000 (L:1×120s bin1) cropped
Location:Remotely from Auberry, California (USA)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/2014s2-panstarrs-20150920/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo

Date:  Mon, 28 Sep 2015 10:46:41 +0000
From:  Soulier Jean-FranÃ§ois 
Subject:  Image a comet 1° of the Full Moon ? If it's possible ...
Good morning.
It was a dream for a long time ...
But this required several conditions to make it happen.
- First of all the good weather (in the north of France is never a foregone conclusion) and that was the case tonight,
- A fairly bright comet (mag < 17 if possible), and very close to the Full Moon,
- But above all, a "total eclipse of the Moon" at the time !!
Here is image 57P de Toit Neujmin Delporte, made only 1°17' lunar elongation !
Without filter, 20x60s ...
Description and images of the moment (with my child 9 years) on the following link :
http://6888comete.free.fr/fr/image57PToitNeujminDelportefrance.htm
Sincerely
Soulier Jean-François
C10 / France
Date:  Mon, 28 Sep 2015 08:19:57 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] Image a comet 1° of the Full Moon ? If it's possible ...
Very nice and unique shot, but maybe time to clean the sensor? ;)

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

Date:  Mon, 28 Sep 2015 21:14:45 +0000
From:  Soulier Jean-FranÃ§ois 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] Image a comet 1° of the Full Moon ? If it's possible ...
Thanks Chris.

"but maybe time to clean the sensor?"
No...alignment mark on the M2 surface / incident on reflection corrector lenses with the moon : 1°...
Best regard.
JFS

Date:  Wed, 30 Sep 2015 11:53:26 +0200
From:  Bernhard Häusler 
Subject:  image of C/2014 R3 (PANSTARRS) on September,29 2015
Hi,
the comet is observed since September 2014 with 71 observations up to now in the MPC database and easy to photograph.
Based on the last epoch, its actual period is ~10,000,000 years with an eccentricity of 0.9999192 and its actual distance is about
7.54 AU from sun.
Perhaps the comet is a returner indeed.
http://www.b82maidbronn.de/c2014r3_20150929.htm
CS Bernhard
http://www.b82maidbronn.de/ 

Date:  Wed, 30 Sep 2015 05:24:36 -0700

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

Alfons Diepvens 
Date:  Fri, 02 Oct 2015 22:53:36 +0000
From:  Charles Bell 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] Observation of comets


Your image of 19P/Borrelly is quite unusual.
I wonder if this is the "Strong seasonal jet" referred to by Michael S.P. Kelly on the web page:
http://www.astro.umd.edu/~msk/blog/articles/spitzer-comet-survey-jan15

Comet 19P/Borrelly exhibits seasonal variations in dust morphology according to a paper

Schleicher, David G.; Woodney, Laura M.; Millis, Robert L., Comet 19P/Borrelly at multiple apparitions: seasonal variations in gas production and dust morphology, Icarus, Volume 162, Issue 2, p. 415-442. (04/2003)

http://adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/2003Icar..162..415S

Date:  Fri, 09 Oct 2015 15:03:20 -0000
From:  Martin Mobberley 
Subject:  50p Arend near Neptune on Oct 9th via itel Siding Spring
50P is arrowed at around 16th mag. Neptune dead centre.
The faint trail of stars just above the comet (20th mag?) are
real, even though they look like hot pixels!

http://martinmobberley.co.uk/images/50p_20151009_1258_mpm.jpg

Regards,
Martin

Comet page:

http://martinmobberley.co.uk/Comets.html 

Date:  Fri, 09 Oct 2015 18:46:40 +0200
From:  Emilio Gálvez 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] 50p Arend near Neptune on Oct 9th via itel Siding Spring
Hi Martin,

The faint trail of stars just above the comet are real and you can see it
in the attached image from SDSS9 in Aladin.

Regards,
Emilio

2015-10-09 17:03 GMT+02:00 'Martin Mobberley'
martin.mobberley@btinternet.com [Comet-Images] >:

> 50P is arrowed at around 16th mag. Neptune dead centre.
> The faint trail of stars just above the comet (20th mag?) are
> real, even though they look like hot pixels!
>
> http://martinmobberley.co.uk/images/50p_20151009_1258_mpm.jpg

Date:  Fri, 09 Oct 2015 10:38:42 -0700
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] 50p Arend near Neptune on Oct 9th via itel Siding Spring
Nice Martin! that fast focal ratio gives tiny stars.

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

On Fri, 10/9/15, 'Martin Mobberley' martin.mobberley@btinternet.com [Comet-Images] wrote:

Subject: [Comet-Images] 50p Arend near Neptune on Oct 9th via itel Siding Spring
To: Comet-Images@yahoogroups.com
Date: Friday, October 9, 2015, 7:03 AM

50P is arrowed at around 16th mag.
Neptune dead centre.
The faint trail of stars just above the comet (20th mag?)
are
real, even though they look like hot pixels!

http://martinmobberley.co.uk/images/50p_20151009_1258_mpm.jpg

Regards,
Martin

Comet page:

http://martinmobberley.co.uk/Comets.html

------------------------------------
Posted by: "Martin Mobberley"
------------------------------------

Date:  Sat, 10 Oct 2015 08:46:11 -0000
From:  Martin Mobberley 
Subject:  Re: 50p Arend near Neptune on Oct 9th via itel Siding Spring
Thanks Emilio + Chris,
Yes, I checked the STScI DSS just to be sure, as they looked
exactly like hot pixels when I first saw them!

Regards,
Martin

>Hi Martin,

The faint trail of stars just above the comet are real and you can see it
in the attached image from SDSS9 in Aladin.

Regards,
Emilio<

Date:  Thu, 15 Oct 2015 09:28:49 +0000
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet 67P (Sep 23rd.)
Hi all,
A belated image of 67P. Conditions were excellent for this capture. Note the very faint diffuse dust tail.
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/67p_2015_09_23dpc.jpg
24"CDK with FLI CCD. LRGB. 30/3/3/3min.
Damian

Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/

Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk

Date:  Sat, 17 Oct 2015 15:59:46 +0200
From:  ligustri rolando 
Subject:  evolution of comet 17P
Hello everyone
in a few days it will have passed eight years since the comet 17P Holmes had a
huge outburst.to remember this wonderful phenomenon
I wanted to create a poster with the pictures that I have, with the same
resolution

http://spaceweathergallery.com/indiv_upload.php?upload_id=119024&PHPSESSID=6a6718scfp8fg7dcv7mol7f3s4

best regards
Rolando Ligustri
===============================
C.A.R.A. http://cara.uai.it

close to what I could see on CCD images - it's not always the case
with diffuse objects.

Luc

Date:  Tue, 20 Oct 2015 13:30:00 +0200
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko on Sep-26
Object/Date:67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko @ Sep.26,2015
Description:Comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko imaged on September 26th 2015 in its maximum brightness near magnitude 11, shows in this image a tail of 4 minutes long. Under the comet can see the spiral galaxy UGC 4853 with magnitude 14.6.
Tech data:Planewave 24" CDK & FLI PL09000 (L:1×120s bin1) cropped
Location:Remotely from Auberry, California (USA)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/67p-churyumov-gerasimenko-20150926/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo 

Date:  Wed, 21 Oct 2015 17:22:31 +0200
From:  Luc ARNOLD 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko on Sep-26
nice and clean image, Jos - the coma seems to be slightly asymmetric ?
best
L

Date:  Sun, 25 Oct 2015 19:15:22 +0100
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2013 US10 Catalina (Oct.1,2015)
Object/Date:C/2013 US10 (Catalina) @ Oct.1,2015
Description:Comet C/2013 US10 (Catalina) imaged on October 1st 2015, my last photo taken from Southern Hemisphere before the comet left to be observable because its angular approach to the Sun. In this wide field image the comet shines near 7th magnitude and shows a greenish coma, due to gas emission of diatomic carbon, with 8 minutes of diameter. The tail with 3 degrees long, on the rich stellar background between constellations of Centaurus and Lupus, shows details and structural shapes. The most brightest star on upper is B Centauri with magnitude 4.
Tech data:Takahashi FSQ ED 106mm. f/5.0 & FLI ML16803 (L:3×180 Bin1 + RGB:1x60 Bin2) cropped
Location:Remotely from Siding Spring (Australia)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/2013us10-catalina-20151001/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo 

Date:  Sun, 25 Oct 2015 21:15:04 +0000
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet 67P on Oct 22nd.
Hi all,
Here is a recent image of 67P. No real change in appearance from when i last captured it. Perhaps the colour looks somewhat more pale than it was a month back.
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/67p_2015_10_22dp.jpg
24"CDK with FLI CCD. LRGB. 20/2/2/2min.
Best Wishes
Damian

Date:  Tue, 10 Nov 2015 03:52:04 +0000
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Comet Panstarrs 2014 S2
Hello All,

Cant tell all of you how excited I am to be able to be out imaging again, now that our long rainy monsoon here in Arizona is finally over! Also, this comet finally got far enough away from polaris so I can image it without my roll off roof on my observatory blocking it.

Here is my stationary comet/stars trailed (colored) version:

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/PanstarrsS2-110815.html

I shot two other comets last night too, Jaques in cygnus, and panstarrs X1 in perseus....

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com 

Date:  Tue, 10 Nov 2015 10:52:02 +0000
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] Comet Panstarrs 2014 S2
Lovely image Chris, one of the best ive seen of this so far. I guess this one is a nice distraction before C/2013 US10 re-appears!
C/2013 X1 looks quite peculiar in the images ive seen. Look forward to see your image of that.
Damian

From: "Chris Schur comets133@yahoo.com [Comet-Images]"
To: Comet Group
Sent: Tuesday, 10 November 2015, 3:52
Subject: [Comet-Images] Comet Panstarrs 2014 S2

  Hello All,

Cant tell all of you how excited I am to be able to be out imaging again, now that our long rainy monsoon here in Arizona is finally over! Also, this comet finally got far enough away from polaris so I can image it without my roll off roof on my observatory blocking it.

Here is my stationary comet/stars trailed (colored) version:

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/PanstarrsS2-110815.html

I shot two other comets last night too, Jaques in cygnus, and panstarrs X1 in perseus....

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com

{color:#666666;font-size:10px;overflow:hidden;text-align:center;white-space:nowrap;width:64px;}#yiv6648120067 #yiv6648120067reco-category {font-size:77%;}#yiv6648120067 #yiv6648120067reco-desc {font-size:77%;}#yiv6648120067 .yiv6648120067replbq {margin:4px;}#yiv6648120067 #yiv6648120067ygrp-actbar div a:first-child {margin-right:2px;padding-right:5px;}#yiv6648120067 #yiv6648120067ygrp-mlmsg {font-size:13px;font-family:Arial, helvetica, clean, sans-serif;}#yiv6648120067 #yiv6648120067ygrp-mlmsg table {font-size:inherit;font:100%;}#yiv6648120067 #yiv6648120067ygrp-mlmsg select, #yiv6648120067 input, #yiv6648120067 textarea {font:99% Arial, Helvetica, clean, sans-serif;}#yiv6648120067 #yiv6648120067ygrp-mlmsg pre, #yiv6648120067 code {font:115% monospace;}#yiv6648120067 #yiv6648120067ygrp-mlmsg * {line-height:1.22em;}#yiv6648120067 #yiv6648120067ygrp-mlmsg #yiv6648120067logo {padding-bottom:10px;}#yiv6648120067 #yiv6648120067ygrp-msg p a {font-family:Verdana;}#yiv6648120067 #yiv6648120067ygrp-msg p#yiv6648120067attach-count span {color:#1E66AE;font-weight:700;}#yiv6648120067 #yiv6648120067ygrp-reco #yiv6648120067reco-head {color:#ff7900;font-weight:700;}#yiv6648120067 #yiv6648120067ygrp-reco {margin-bottom:20px;padding:0px;}#yiv6648120067 #yiv6648120067ygrp-sponsor #yiv6648120067ov li a {font-size:130%;text-decoration:none;}#yiv6648120067 #yiv6648120067ygrp-sponsor #yiv6648120067ov li {font-size:77%;list-style-type:square;padding:6px 0;}#yiv6648120067 #yiv6648120067ygrp-sponsor #yiv6648120067ygrp-text tt {font-size:120%;}#yiv6648120067 #yiv6648120067ygrp-vital ul li:last-child {border-right:none !important;}#yiv6648120067 


Date:  Tue, 10 Nov 2015 12:01:28 +0100
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2015 V2 Johnson  on Nov. 6 (image and video)
Object/Date:Comet C/2015 V2 (Johnson) @ November 6, 2015
Description:Comet C/2015 V2 (Johnson) imaged on November 6th 2015, only 3 days after be discovered, with a brightness of magnitude 17 and a diameter of 10 arcseconds. The most bright star in the field has 7th magnitude, and some galaxies very faint and hard to identify appears scattered. This comet could be observable with small binoculars on mid 2017.
Location:Benali, Valencia (Spain) Tech data:GSO 8" @ f/3.8 reflector & Canon EOS-100D camera (4x240 sec. at ISO 1600) cropped
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/2015v2-johnson-20151106/
You cand find also a movie with 10 shots cropped showing the movement of the C/2015 V2 (Johnson) on November 6th with a total time of 40 minutes.

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo

From: "Chris Schur
comets133@yahoo.com [Comet-Images]"


To: Comet
Group

Sent: Tuesday,
10 November 2015, 3:52
Subject: [Comet-Images]
Comet Panstarrs 2014 S2

Hello
All,

Cant tell all of you how excited I am to be able to be out
imaging again, now that our long rainy monsoon here in
Arizona is finally over! Also, this comet finally got far
enough away from polaris so I can image it without my roll
off roof on my observatory blocking it.

Here is my stationary comet/stars trailed (colored)
version:

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/PanstarrsS2-110815.html

I shot two other comets last night too, Jaques in cygnus,
and panstarrs X1 in perseus....

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal:
http://www.schursastrophotography.com

Date:  Thu, 12 Nov 2015 02:37:12 +0000
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Comet Panstarrs X1 - a Spiral comet
Greetings all,

My last offering from the night of the 8th, and this one is surely a imagers delight. Mostly an off white color, the comet sports a twisted tail and offset nucleus. You can find my new image at:

http://www.schursastrophotography.com/newcomets/PanstarrsX1-110815.html

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Schur's Web Portal: http://www.schursastrophotography.com 

Date:  Thu, 12 Nov 2015 17:44:47 +0100
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2014 S2 PANSTARRS on Nov. 6
Object/Date:Comet C/2014 S2 (PANSTARRS) @ November 6, 2015
Description:Comet C/2014 S2 (PANSTARRS) imaged on November 6th 2015, shows a green-bluish coma wich denoting emission of a mix several gases and with an apparent diameter of 7 arcminutes (near 600.000 Km. absolutes). Also highlighted a dust tail with nearly 0.5 deg long. Comet has here a brightness of 9,5 magnitude, whereas the most bright star in the image has 6th magnitude, into the Ursa Minor.
Location:Benali, Valencia (Spain) Tech data:GSO 8" @ f/3.8 reflector & Canon EOS-100D camera (11x120 sec. at ISO 1600)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/2014s2-panstarrs-20151106/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo

Subject:  C/2013 X1 (Panstarrs) on Nov 10th

20"CDK with FLI CCD. LRGB. 25/2/2/2min.

Object/Date:Comet C/2014 S2
(PANSTARRS) @ November 6, 2015
Description:Comet C/2014
S2 (PANSTARRS) imaged on November 6th 2015, shows a
green-bluish coma wich denoting emission of a mix several
gases and with an apparent diameter of 7 arcminutes (near
600.000 Km. absolutes). Also highlighted a dust tail with
nearly 0.5 deg long. Comet has here a brightness of 9,5
magnitude, whereas the most bright star in the image has 6th
magnitude, into the Ursa Minor.
Location:Benali, Valencia
(Spain) Tech
data:GSO 8" @ f/3.8 reflector & Canon
EOS-100D camera (11x120 sec. at ISO 1600)
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/2014s2-panstarrs-20151106/

Regards.
José
J. Chambó (Valencia,
Spain)blog: cometografia.es
twitter: @PepeChambo

#yiv4174269446

Object/Date:Comet C/2014 S2

(PANSTARRS) @ November 6, 2015

Description:Comet C/2014

S2 (PANSTARRS) imaged on November 6th 2015, shows a

green-bluish coma wich denoting emission of a mix several

gases and with an apparent diameter of 7 arcminutes (near

600.000 Km. absolutes). Also highlighted a dust tail with

nearly 0.5 deg long. Comet has here a brightness of 9,5

magnitude, whereas the most bright star in the image has 6th

magnitude, into the Ursa Minor.

Location:Benali, Valencia

(Spain) Tech

data:GSO 8" @ f/3.8 reflector & Canon

EOS-100D camera (11x120 sec. at ISO 1600)

Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/2014s2-panstarrs-20151106/

Regards.

José

J. Chambó (Valencia,

Spain)blog: cometografia.es

twitter: @PepeChambo

Date:  Fri, 13 Nov 2015 15:18:48 -0800
From:  michaeljaeger@gmx.at
Subject:  2014 S2 Nov 11 10"/4 SXV-H9 3x3 min
http://www.astrobin.com/full/226353/0/ http://www.astrobin.com/full/226353/0/

regards
Michael Jäger 
Date:  Sun, 15 Nov 2015 22:45:05 +0100
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  C/2013 X1 PANSTARRS on Nov. 6
Object/Date:Comet C/2013 X1 (PANSTARRS) @ November 6, 2015
Description:Comet C/2013 X1 (PANSTARRS) imaged on November 6th 2015, increasing speedily its brightness in this image has magnitude 10.5 and shows an asymmetric coma very whitish without perceive emission of carbonic gases, also displays a short dust tail of 5 arcmin longitude.
Location:Benali, Valencia (Spain) Tech data:GSO 8" @ f/3.8 reflector & Canon EOS-100D camera (5x120 sec. at ISO 1600) cropped
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/2013x1-panstarrs-20151106/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo 

Date:  Sun, 15 Nov 2015 22:10:14 +0000
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet 67P on Nov 9th
Hi all.
Here is an image of 67P from November 9th.
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/67p_2015_11_09dp.jpg
17"CDK with FLI CCD. LRGB. 25/2/2/2min.
Best Wishes
Damian

Web: http://www.damianpeach.com/
FB: http://www.facebook.com/peachastro
Email: dpeach_78@yahoo.co.uk
************************************************* 

Date:  Mon, 16 Nov 2015 01:28:17 +0000
From:  Chris Schur 
Subject:  Re: [Comet-Images] Comet 67P on Nov 9th

Clear Skies,

Chris Schur

Date:  Wed, 18 Nov 2015 17:09:49 +0100
From:  "José J. Chambó" 
Subject:  10P/Tempel on Nov. 6
Object/Date:Comet 10P/Tempel @ November 6, 2015
Description:Comet 10P/Tempel imaged on November 6th 2015 near the globular cluster M 28. With a brightness of magnitude 11 the comet appears lost between thousand stars into most dense zone of the Milky Way in Sagittarius, only the intense blue color of its gassy coma, betrays its presence.
Location:Benali, Valencia (Spain) Tech data:GSO 8" @ f/3.8 reflector & Canon EOS-100D camera (5x120 sec. at ISO 800) cropped
Post and image link:http://cometografia.es/10p-tempel-20151106/

Regards.
José J. Chambó (Valencia, Spain)blog: cometografia.es twitter: @PepeChambo 

Date:  Wed, 18 Nov 2015 22:00:22 +0000
From:  Damian Peach 
Subject:  Comet 67P on Nov 12th
Hi all,
Here is 67P from November 12th. Note the small ring galaxy IC 2628 toward the far end of the comets tail.
http://www.damianpeach.com/deepsky/67p_2015_11_12dp.jpg
24"CDK with FLI CCD. LRGB. 20/2/2/2mins.
Best Wishes
Damian
